notes: Written by Badīʻ al-Dīn valad-i Kamāl al-Dīn ibn Rukn al-Dīn ...
Former owner's name at end: "Herbert Lloyd, Sept. 1775."
Paper; cream color laid paper with no visible lines or watermarks; text in ruled border of six thin lines of black, red and blue; black ink with rubrication and red overlining.
Rieu, Charles. Catalogue of the Persian manuscripts in the British Museum, p. 764
Rypka. History of Iranian literature, p. 633
Nastaʻliq; 15 lines in written area 14.2 x 6.5 cm.
Library of Congress. Persian manuscript, M113.
Also available in digital form on the Library of Congress website.
item.title: Ḥikāyat-i Sayf al-Mulūk va Badīʻ al-Jamāl.
summary: Tale of Sayf al-Mulūk and Badiʼʻ al-Jamāl, also recorded in an Arabic version in the Arabian Nights.
medium: 64 leaves (15 lines), paper : bound ; 15.5 x 9.5 cm
other_title: حكايت سيف الملوك و بديع الجمال.
Qiṣṣah-i Sayf al-Mulūk va Badīʻ al-Jamāl
